direction.raw_text: The setting sun backlights a series of abstract colored images. Holy images of STAINED GLASS and lead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: across the marble floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - JULIE JAMES A little older, a little wiser, yet still very pretty, no doubt. But she's all alone in the house of the Lord. And those doleful eyes of hers clearly telegraph a very heavy burden still rests upon her soul. She reluctantly walks past the rows of empty pews toward a curtained
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie slides the drapes shut behind her as she enters, kneeling before the CLOSED SCREEN. A beat -- and the SCREEN SLIDES OPEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the adjacent booth -- barely visible through the WICKER MESH. Julie looks down, crosses herself, and begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie swallows hard. This is difficult for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She balks at the memory of it. The priest bows his head in the shadows of the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The confession is cathartic for Julie. She looks relieved until,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie stops. Looks through the screen. A chill shoots through her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clouds of icy steam shoot through the partition. Julie moves closer to the screen, trying to get a better look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. (a beat) It's been a year since my last confession...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I've never told anyone this. Not my mom, not the poice, not even my friends -- except for the ones who were there and they...well they're not around anymore. You see I...I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I killed a man. Well, I thought I had...then...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (emotional) You've got to understand...It was all an accident. A terrible accident. It's been a whole year. I've tried to get past this, but I just can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have these dreams...horrible dreams. And this man is always there with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reassuring) I know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see, he was a killer. He murdered Helen and Barry, and he would have killed me too, if I hadn't...gotten away with it. (regathering) I don't know, I guess I just need to deal with the fear, the guilt...to finally say his name. Ben Willis. His name was Ben Willis...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know? But how could you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (growls)
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.ToD: I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER
result.heading: I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER

direction.raw_text: smashes through the screen right in Julie's face! She SCREAMS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still screaming -- Julie jumps back, seemingly knocked out of her chair. She fights the unseen demon. Sitting beside her, Julie's friend WILL BENSON reacts. He's a good- looking kid in a shy, humble kind of way. And he tries to help her, but she's too busy turning ten shades of red. The PROFESSOR lowers his glasses, makes it even worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lecture hall erupts with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie grabs her stuff and bolts.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice to see you find Political Science so stimulating --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Julie explodes out of the building. Hurries down a sidewalk. Will finally catches up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie realizes this is true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will takes this seriously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Julie! Wait! You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't seem fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had another dream, Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The shower again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was in a church...it was so real. I mean, I could feel his breath on me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (caring) I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought I was over the dreams for good. I really did. I hadn't had one for months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It just takes time, Julie. It's gonna get better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It can't get worse. I mean, it's not like this was the first time I freaked out in class. I hardly ever get a full night's sleep, my grades suck, I'm this close from being thrown out of school.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! BLAM! BLAM! EXPLOSIONS. Julie jumps out of her skin. It's just
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: letting off FIRECRACKERS as they fly past on bicycles. Will and Julie are now thinking the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles at her. She smiles back. They stop in front of her apartment building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She touches his face affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stands there akwardly -- WILL Um...Okay. Bye. Will walks away. Julie watches him a beat, then turns down her walk -- RAY steps out of the shadows. Julie practically faints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recovering, she hugs Ray, genuinely glad to see him. He's a bit cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It should be obvious Ray feels insecure in the college environs, but they're miscommunicating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at Ray, his compassionate demeanor. This is hard to say -- JULIE (softly, but resolved) Ray, I can't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is cold. This is what he's expected all along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is hurt and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray starts walking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray keeps on walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie follows him out to the road. A group of LAUGHING STUDENTS block her way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Ray is already gone. Julie stares after him a beat, then turns quickly to her door. She clearly feels uncomfortable, exposed on the walk alone. She nervously pulls her keys. A can of mace dangles from the keychain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It was one year ago...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's...the anniversary. That's what's going on...Take it easy on yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weary) I'm trying. I really am...Sometimes I don't even know why I came up here in the first place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cheering her up) To get out of Southport?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softens) Right. Now I remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Are you getting out of town on the fourth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah. I'll probably just be here studying for finals. The joys of summer school... (beat) Are you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for the talk, Will. You're good to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my god, Ray. You scared me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got in early. I was excited... (re: the receding Will) Who was that guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's Will. He's a friend. You'd like him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray, we're just friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every guy in history who tried to pick up a girl did the good-friend thing first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you being like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I'm sorry. You're right. Are you ready to go? I've got the old truck. You know the drill...Crab boil at Ollie's. Croaker Queen Pageant...It's only small-town fun, but it's still nice. People really miss you. I miss you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just feel like some part of me hasn't healed up enough to go back. Like some critical piece is missing. Please understand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not like that. It's not you. It's me. My head. I want to go back. I want to be with you. I want to be fine. I want everything to be like it used to be. (beat) It just isn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Hey, why don't you stay up here? They have fireworks over the river. And...there's a million things to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to work, Julie. My boat's in Southport, remember? But, I get it. You need your space from Craokerland. And maybe from me, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You know where to find me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray? Ray? At least come up for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay. I'm just gonna go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray, I'm sorry. I didn't mean... (to herself) I'm just scared...that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Students throw FRISBEE in the street. Ray walks to his old truck, which is wedged between a new Sport Utility and a BMW. He clambers into the front seat. He thinks. Then, digs into his pocket and pulls out the unmistakable shape of an ENGAGEMENT RING BOX. He throws it in the glove box, starts the truck and drives away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie opens the door and steps inside. She locks three deadbolts. She stands there, alone, listening to the SILENCE. She doesn't even have a cat. A faucet DRIPS in the kitchen. 6A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The faucet DRIPS. Julie turns the handle. No success. She checks the lock on each window. She stands for a moment. She picks up a bag of chips and eats a handful. She opens the fridge and takes out a can of nacho cheese sauce. She grabs a soft drink and a jar of bread-and-butter pickles. She gets some cookies from a shelf. She thinks. Opens the freezer, pulls out some fat-free sorbet. She takes the whole mess toward her bedroom. 6B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hits the light switch. A bedside light goes on. It's a sparsely furnished room. The bed is pilled high with pillows. She checks the windows, then climbs into bed with the food. On the bedside table are pictures of family and friends. She looks at one of Helen and Barry. She looks around the room. It's depressing. Outside we hear young people having fun, slamming car doors, going places. She picks at the food, then puts it on the table. She turns off the bedside light and enjoys the golden late afternoon glow in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie, sound asleep, is curled into fetal position on the bed. There's a CLICK in the front hall. And ANOTHER. Julie's eyes shoot open. She listens. Another SOUND, almost like the front door being CLOSED. Her arm reaches for the bedside light. She hits the switch. The bulb
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets off the bed and stands still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's another NOISE down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie silently scoots out of her bedroom toward the kitchen. 6D
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Okay. Okay. Face your fears...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (whisper) There's nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (whisper) Quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She gets a large KNIFE. She listens. It sounds like somone's in the living room. She steps through the kitchen door. As she moves we see a shadow pass the other way down the hallway toward her bedroom. 6E
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's NO ONE there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She relaxes until she sees that her front door is slightly AJAR, light from the hallway slanting through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holding the knife in front of her, she tiptoes to the hallway. There's a soft RUSTLING coning from her bedroom. She gets a flashlight out of a drawer and starts down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves faster toward her bedroom. she listens outside the doorway. It sounds like someone's in the closet. She moves into the room. 6F
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Okay, calm down, imagination.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I can't take this anymore. I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (fatalistic) Let's just do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There's a noise in the darkened closet. Julie moves into position. She turns the flashlight ON and lunges for the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all grace and attitude, is on tiptoes reaching for a box of shoes. She SCREAMS. Julie SCREAMS. They both SCREAM together. Julie drops the knife and flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hug, jumping up and down with relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie turns on the light in the hallway. Karla has her shoes in her hand and black pants draped over her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla looks down and sees the knife. She picks it up with two fingers -- KARLA (cont'd) And we're going to put away the utensils and you're coming with me. Julie flops down on her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla picks up the flashlight and goes into the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She emerges with clothes for Julie. Holds up one outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla holds up another dress for Julie -- strapless, sexy, the one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla is dancing around. Julie laughs at her friend and takes the dress when Karla hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were out of town!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in my closet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were out of town!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in my closet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: i just wanted your black pants, but I'm not ready to die for them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was heart attack time, Karla.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. When I put these skinny pants on my body...Now, that's heart attack time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere. I'm fat, ugly, and depressed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, right -- whatever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I just really hurt Ray's feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (keeping it upbeat) Listen to me, Julie. Ray's a great guy, nothing against old Ray, but he's so...Ray. I mean, he lives in Southport. Will's a nice guy, too, and he lives right down the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing between Will and me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yet. Nothing yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What we gotta do is keep moving. No time to mope. I'm working at the club tonight. And you, dancing queen, are coming with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No I'm not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine, then be fat, ugly, and depressed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's a hopping college joint: crowded, loud MUSIC, a dance floor, and rivers of cheap booze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie sits next to Karla as she waits for her drink order. A handsome young man slides in front of them. This is TYRELL MARTIN, 23, handsome, no pretention, a little dangerous, with a killer smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's looking for a dark corner or a storeroom or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's kissing her ear. She starts to giggle. The bartender sets down drinks on Karla's tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrell hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla cuts away through the crowd, delivering drinks. Tyrell turns to Julie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla passes by -- KARLA Say yes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what I want to do to you ...right now, don't you? There's gotta be somewhere we can be alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (playful) I don't think so. It's pretty crowded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just for a minute, baby. I got something I wanna tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (teasing) If you can say all you gotta say in a minute then I don't wanna hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll talk real slow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: Julie) Ask her to dance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're the most beautiful woman in the bar tonight, Jules.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tyrell, you are an unstoppable force of nature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. It's how the species survives. You'll never convince me otherwise. (beat) Wanna dance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No means yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tyrell, I appreciate it, but have you seen my people dance? We make the mouth face, we move the fingers -- TYRELL (heading for the floor) Worse comes to worse, you can stand there and watch me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, I'll take a break and we'll all dance. 7A
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is packed and thumping. Karla is dancing her way through the crowd. Tyrell and Julie follow behind her. Karla sees Will. He's dressed up and nervous. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will looks down at his feet. He and Julie stand there not quite knowing what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrell and Karla go for it on the dance floor, leaving Will and Julie alone. They look at each other. They look at everyone dancing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will is a few steps ahead as they move for the bar. Julie seems to be relaxing, having a good time. Then, she looks up into the balcony and sees, in a strobe light's FLASH -- SOMEONE IN A SLICKER watching her intently. She squints for a better look, but he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's chalk white and crestfallen. Her whole affect is "Will I ever have a normal time?" She drifts amay toward the stairs to the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will catches Karla and Tyrell's eyes. They're worried. 7B
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Whaddayou know? Will Benson lookin' fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suspicious, but having fun) Karla! Did you tell him I'd be here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope. I told him that you absolutely, positively would not be here at this bar between ten o'clock and eleven o'clock tonight. And then he came anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shy to a fault) This was not my idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said, this...Do you want a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where I come from, you want to snatch the goodies, you got to at least talk to them first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling over the din) You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Hey Julie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Julie catches another glimps of THE SLICKER. She pushes her way through the crowd up the stairs. 7C
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie looks all around -- finally spotting the MAN IN THE SLICKER from behind, making his way to the other side. He slices through a crowd of students, and Julie keeps following. He turns down a service corridor. Julie follows, frightened, but unable to resist. She catches him at the end of the corridor. She reaches out and grabs the stranger's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stranger turns around. It's only a club kid in a tacky vinyl raincoat and hat. She's shaken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie turns away and hurries down the hallway. Todd follows, but his figure quickly fades.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ben...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hye, baby. You following me up here? (a come-on) Well, all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With morning sun filtering through her blinds, Julie wakes up to the strange sound of THUMPING. She gets out of bed and slowly exits the room. 8A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The noise gets louder as she heads down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The noise is at its loudest -- Julie reaches for a doorknob -- and yanks open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rocking and banging inside the closet. Julie frowns. Julie spins, once again startled by Karla, who crosses to the dryer, flipping open the lid and then jumping back to catch the shoes as they pop out on the fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone RINGS. Karla looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (still sleepy) That could break the machine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Julie, people who end up making rules like that end up beating their kids with wire hangers. It's a fact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's Tyrell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resigned) The number's unlisted...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you relax? We've been dating three months. He ain't stalking your butt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, okay. You're right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it, and it feels good. (answering the phone) Hi, Ty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: for a local radio station BOOMS from the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie watches her friend get excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie hits the SPEAKERPHONE BUTTON and Karla hangs up. The DJ's voice echos through the appartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla's smile abruptly fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks to Julie, whose face is as blank as hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie has an idea. She scramles for the kitchen. Grabs a BAG OF FRESH- GROUND COFFEE from the FREEZER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie tosses the bag across the room to Karla. Karla reads the label:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) This is Mark in the Morning for Magic 96.7 Radio Station! Who am I speaking with?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mark in the Morning! Magic 96.7! Oh my God! I'm Karla. Karla Wilson. (to Julie) Jules, it's Mark in the Morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Well, Karla, what're you doin' at home over the long fourth weekend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm in school and -- MARK (V.O.) How'd you like to win a Magic 96.7 Quicky Getaway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Good, then I hope you remember your geography, Karla, because all you have to do to win is tell me the capital of Brazil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Brazil? Um...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You don't know?! You have to know. You know everything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon, Karla, one easy question, one great getaway!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) ...South America...Carnival...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Karla, we need an answer. No looking it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still here...thinking... (stalling) You mean Brazil, the country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Okay, Karla, five seconds. (counting down) Five...Four...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd, V.O.) Three...Two...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: % BRAZILIAN COFFEE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (blurting) Rio de Janeiro!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh, no...Did you say Rio?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wincing) No. Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and WHISTLES and triumphant MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karla and Julie jump up and down ecstatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie hangs up and joins Karla dancing on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie thinks, she seems torn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You just won Magic 96.7's Quickie Getaway...a trip for four to Tower Bay Island in the fabulous Bahamas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Waaaaahhhhhhhhhh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We'll call you back with all the details...So what's your favorite radio station?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Magic 96.7!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won. I won...I won, I won, I won. (teasing) Now, let's see...There's Tyrell, that's one. And, there's my parents ...And I got some cousins. (beat) Okay, Julie, you can come, but Mark said four tickets. That means you gotta get yourself a date.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is DUMPED -- wiggling and suffocating its way across the deck of a fishing boat.
